title: The Gambler
body:
Who is the gambler in Tahm Kench's lore?
It has already been established in the Q&A that it is not TF

replies.body: A random example of a person that had dealings with Tahm?

Riddle me this.    
He is a random person to interact with the demon.   
But he is not random to Tahm Kench.     
So what's the name of the Gambler.
A man with troubles, for whom Tahm Kench had solutions...
His name is Helmet Bro and this is his beginning.
No his name is/was Tahm Kench, we literally just established this.
The gambler? I was just poking fun because I miss the posts of Helmet Bro (and he does have a cameo in Tahm Kench's joke (when he spits up a helmet)).
Well, that would explain a lot about Helmet Bro bad luck

EDIT: Kadavik deleted post for some reason ;-;

> Theory: At the wedding, the demon inhabited or devoured the gambler, and ate everything (The gambler became Tahm)
That's what it meant by "the fool who let me in"


^ not his exact words

That's actually a pretty good theory.



Tahm Kench is a pretty weird name for a demon, so I'm guessing:

The Gambler's name was Tahm Kench, and the demon had a different name/no name

You win the last cookie.

...And we are legion.
check your riot account

you got a cookie?
Does it mean Tahm Kench (Demon) is actually the same kind of creature than Brand?
Brand is a human barbecue not a demon
If we go that way Brand is AT LEAST a fire spirit inside a human barbecue.
no brand was trapped in a crystal before he was released by some raiders which made his demon like spirit take a human form

> [{quoted}](name=Celio Hogane HD,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=9U6qkXVy,comment-id=000000000006000000000003,timestamp=2015-07-02T01:44:10.811+0000)
>
> Does it mean Tahm Kench (Demon) is actually the same kind of creature than Brand?

The specific demon we all are talking about represents the foibles of mankind (mankind just referring to all fleshy races like the humans and yordles in this case).

The demons current appearance is the embodiment of the gamblers, Tahm Kenches, foibles. The gamblers foibles was gambling, he gambled everything (even his life), which is why the demon took everything he loved (which was the life he had), such path he took with the deal bit him in the ass. He thought he would be safe of his demons, but once you let them in your life, you are a fool that let it in and screwed yourself in the long process. 

Also as many rioters have pointed out in the Q&A, the demon encountered many champions (which means many champions have this inner demon inside them) some as fellows or adversaries (those that are consumed by their inner demons, and those that overcome them).  

But the fun thing about Runeterra is that even your inner demons take shape in the physical world. Ill take Game of Thrones world any day now since I now even worse things exist in this setting.

Regardless, I really like the concept behind this champion, the demon thing is something unique.
And I am Shepard?
Yeah i wasnt really confident on that theory.  Oh well enjoy the cookie.
Hue, you should've kept it there ^-^

Hah, yeah ill definitely think twice about deleting any comments of mine, thanks for believing in my idea when I couldnt. 

Im curious though, what did WAAARGHbobo  give you. And why didnt I get any of it? ;-; Is cookie a codeword for something now?

I was just joking about the 4000 RP.... but for some reason I have 2000 extra RP on my account ;-;


Thanks  for the RP bobo, if it was you :D

I want some RP too ;-;... it was my theory. I think it was a bet between the champion development guys or something. Whoever guessed the identity of the gamble got the 2000 RP. @WAAARGHbobo please clear this up. My sweet sweet Zac chromas are drifting off into the horizon never to be reached again :(
I'm not sure if it was from Riot for this, but if it was, then ya, you deserve it. You came up with the theory, I just said "Yeah, this is great!"

Thanks dude, by the way is your summoner name a reference to the Heroes of Olympus saga by Rick Riordan? Seeing how you have the word trident in there which might reference the main character Percy Jackson, and SPQR being the roman legion Motto.

Yup, was a huge fan of that series... until the last book ruined it ;c 
Still a fan ofc :P

> [{quoted}](name=TridentSPQR,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=9U6qkXVy,comment-id=0000000000060000,timestamp=2015-07-02T00:16:02.409+0000)

> 
> The Gambler's name was Tahm Kench, and the demon had a different name/no name

Yep. He take everything from you, even your name.
Helmet Bro's 3rd cousin:Gambler,the Unlucky Player.

Tanks to Trident SPQR for believing in my answer to the riddle even though I deleted it. 

Here it is once again. 

Tahm Kench is actually the name of the gambler. He was in trouble and made a deal with a swamp demon to save his neck. It worked, he managed to get out of trouble and get a new life in another town. Years later he met a beautiful woman and asked her to marry him. She said yes and the wedding became a cause of celebration across the whole town. However at the altar the swamp spirit/demon came to claim his end of the bargain. He entered Tahm Kench ,transformed him into the monster we see in the game, now corrupted by the demon he devoured every single guest including his own bride. Thus Tahm Kench had been doomed the moment he struck that deal. That’s why the demon calls him “the fool who let me in”.
Then who was the person holding the bride at 3:03?

The illustrations might be symbolic, you never know with the promo videos, they're always so ambiguous and unrelated to the main story. Nice argument. That was actually one of the reasons why I deleted it.

Is this like the Babadook or something? They even have similar hats...

From what I have gathered from this thread and the Rioters' posts, the Gambler's name is Tahm Kench and he became the River King demon. I like this. Can the bridge of the gambler be the next character? (Akin to Ghost Bride Morgana~)

I always liked this interpretation myself: 
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3bzey3/tahm_kench_originnature_possible_explanation/
The name of the gambler is Tahm Kench and the demon devoured Tahm which meant he like possessed Tahm Kench forcing him to eat everyone.
In TF's lore he found another gambler who new as many tricks as he did. That was his rival Graves. So it might be {{champion:104}} who let tahm in

Well Graves' lore talks about how he lived in the underground for most of his life, and when he got older he started stealing stuff and got caught by Twisted Fate, I doubt he had time to have a wedding or anything like tht. (Or find a Lover)
